Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.github.cowwoc.digitalocean.resource.Database
public final class Database extends Object
A database cluster.

    • getAll

      public static Set<Database> getAll(DigitalOceanClient client) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Returns all the clusters.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      Returns:
      an empty set if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if client is null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • getByPredicate

      public static Database getByPredicate(DigitalOceanClient client, Predicate<Database> predicate) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Returns the first database that matches a predicate.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      predicate - the predicate
      Returns:
      null if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

      Looks up a cluster by its ID.
      Parameters:

      id - the ID
      Returns:
      null if no match is found

    • creator

      public static DatabaseCreator creator(DigitalOceanClient client, String name, DatabaseType databaseType, int numberOfStandbyNodes, DropletType.Id dropletType, Zone.Id zone)
      Creates a database cluster.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      name - the name of the cluster
      databaseType - the type of the database
      numberOfStandbyNodes - the number of standby nodes in the cluster. The cluster includes one primary node, and may include one or two standby nodes.
      dropletType - the machine type of the droplet
      zone - the zone to create the cluster in. To create a cluster that spans multiple regions, add DatabaseReplica to the cluster.
      Returns:
      a new database creator
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if:
      • name contains leading or trailing whitespace or is empty.
      • numberOfStandbyNodes is negative, or greater than 2.
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed

    • id

      public static Database.Id id(String value)
      Creates a new ID.
      Parameters:
      value - the server-side identifier (slug)
      Returns:
      the type-safe identifier for the resource
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if value contains leading or trailing whitespace or is empty

    • setMaintenanceSchedule

      public void setMaintenanceSchedule(DatabaseCreator.MaintenanceSchedule maintenanceSchedule) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException, DatabaseNotFoundException
      Sets the cluster's maintenance schedule.
      Parameters:
      maintenanceSchedule - the maintenance schedule
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if maintenanceSchedule is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the server does not support applying any of the desired changes
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
      DatabaseNotFoundException - if the cluster could not be found
      See Also:
      • KubernetesCreator.copyUnchangeablePropertiesFrom(Kubernetes)

      the updated state

    • matches

      public boolean matches(DatabaseCreator state)
      Determines if the cluster matches the desired state.
      Parameters:
      state - the desired state
      Returns:
      true if the cluster matches the desired state; otherwise, false
      Throws:

    • waitFor

      public Database waitFor(Database.State state, Duration timeout) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException, DatabaseNotFoundException
      Blocks until the cluster reaches the desired state or a timeout occurs.
      Parameters:
      state - the desired state
      timeout - the maximum amount of time to wait
      Returns:
      the updated cluster
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if state is null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the operation times out before the cluster reaches the desired status. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
      DatabaseNotFoundException - if the cluster could not be found
      See Also:
      • waitForDestroy(Duration)

    • waitForDestroy

      public void waitForDestroy(Duration timeout) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Blocks until the cluster deletion completes.
      Parameters:
      timeout - the maximum amount of time to wait
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if state is null
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the operation times out before the cluster reaches the desired status. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
